column4: Hi room.. I have acer aspire 1350 laptop with ubuntu 7. when booting it says failed to alocate memory from xxx to yyyy (some limit) then it boots normally.. but in between it crashes suddenly with power off (no restart) .. i think its ACPI (i may be wrong in the word) problem .. how to rectify this.. as it does not crashes always ...
how much ram do you use?
i have 512 . with 32 mb sharedin video
and how to detect how much ram my ubuntu isusing ??
but i know its less than 512 .. ifyou are sharing it with video
SADLY ... at least i have more then 400 mb it must not at least crash like this !!
if you dont get any help here.. try the forums
lots more users there than here
Gaim default IRC client supplied with Ubuntu says "1188 people in ROOM" not in channel ;)
gaim + LadyNikon = Confused! or LadyNikon- Gaim = Correct
